pynlo.light.Pulse¶

class pynlo.light.Pulse(v_max, dv, n_points, v0=None, a_v=None)[source]¶

Bases: pynlo.utility.TFGrid

An optical pulse, defined over complementary time and frequency grids.

The default initializer creates an empty Pulse object. Set one of four attributes (a_v, p_v, a_t, or p_t) to populate the pulse spectrum or envelope.

Parameters
v_maxfloat

The target maximum frequency.

dvfloat

The target frequency grid step size.

n_pointsint

The number of grid points.

v0float, optional

The comoving frame reference frequency. The default is the center of the resulting frequency grid.

Notes

See TFGrid for other attributes.

The power spectrum and power envelope are normalized to the pulse energy e_p:

e_p == np.sum(p_v*dv) == np.sum(p_t*dt) == np.sum(rp_t*rdt)

The amplitude of the root-power spectrum of the complex envelope is a factor of 2**0.5 larger than the root-power spectrum of the real-valued representation. This difference is due to the real DFT being only the positive side of a double-sided spectrum. When transforming between the two representations use the following normalization:

a_v = 2**0.5 * ra_v[rn_slice]
ra_v[rn_slice] = 2**-0.5 * a_v

Methods¶

__init__(v_max, dv, n_points[, v0, a_v])

Initialize a time and frequency grid given a target maximum frequency, a target frequency step size, and the total number of grid points, and populate with a zero-amplitude power spectrum.

FromTFGrid(tfgrid[, a_v])

Initialize a pulse given a TFGrid instance.

FromPowerSpectrum(v_min, v_max, n_points, p_v)

Initialize a pulse using existing spectral data.

Gaussian(v_min, v_max, n_points, v0, e_p, t_fwhm)

Initialize a gaussian or super-gaussian pulse.

Sech(v_min, v_max, n_points, v0, e_p, t_fwhm)

Initialize a squared hyperbolic secant pulse.

Parabolic(v_min, v_max, n_points, v0, e_p, …)

Initialize a parabolic pulse.

Lorentzian(v_min, v_max, n_points, v0, e_p, …)

Initialize a squared lorentzian pulse.

CW(v_min, v_max, n_points, v0, p_avg)

Initialize an optical spectrum with a single target frequency.

v_width([n])

Calculate the spectral width of the power spectrum.

t_width([n])

Calculate the temporal width of the power envelope.

autocorrelation([n])

Calculate the intensity autocorrelation and related diagnostic information.

spectrogram([t_fwhm, v_range, n_t, t_range])

Calculate the power spectrogram of the pulse convoluted with a gaussian window.

Attributes¶

a_v

The root-power spectrum, with units of (J/Hz)**0.5.

p_v

The power spectrum, with units of J/Hz.

phi_v

The phase of the power spectrum, in radians.

tg_v

The group delay of the power spectrum, with units of s.

a_t

The complex root-power envelope, with units of (J/s)**0.5.

p_t

The power envelope, with units of J/s.

phi_t

The phase of the power envelope, in radians.

vg_t

The instantaneous frequency of the power envelope, with units of Hz.

ra_t

The real-valued instantaneous root-power, with units of (J/s)**0.5.

rp_t

The instantaneous power, with units of J/s.

e_p

The pulse energy, with units of J.
